meanings.definition: The state or condition of being busy.
meanings.sent1: Her busyness at work kept her occupied all day.
meanings.sent2: The busyness of the city streets was overwhelming for the tourists.
meanings.sent3: His busyness trying to juggle multiple tasks at once was quite comical.
meanings.sent4: The busyness of the beehive symbolized the hard work of the bees.
meanings.sent5: The busyness of the ant colony was a sight to behold, with each ant diligently carrying out its tasks.

meanings.definition: The quality or condition of being full of activity or work.
meanings.sent1: The busyness of the factory was evident from the loud machinery sounds.
meanings.sent2: Her schedule was filled with busyness from morning till night.
meanings.sent3: The busyness of the children playing in the park brought joy to the parents watching.
meanings.sent4: The busyness of the market was a hive of activity with vendors calling out to customers.
meanings.sent5: The busyness of the construction site was a symphony of hammering and drilling.

meanings.definition: The state of having a lot of things to do.
meanings.sent1: His busyness with homework left him with little time to relax.
meanings.sent2: The busyness of her daily chores left her feeling exhausted by the end of the day.
meanings.sent3: The busyness of planning a surprise party for her friend was exciting yet challenging.
meanings.sent4: The busyness of organizing a charity event required meticulous planning and coordination.
meanings.sent5: The busyness of preparing for the exam made her prioritize her study time wisely.
